reviewText: My sister had given me this DVD set several years ago, but I loaned it out and never got it back. I was very disappointed, so I was very happy to find it on Amazon. I ordered a new set and watch it every chance I get.It is a very interesting documentary about ghosts and hauntings, several based in England. I'm a Patrick Macnee fan and I think he's wonderful in this series.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Why buy this collection?...you should not really waste your time nor money to buy this. You are better off buying Ghost Stories collection which is pretty much the same thing. I guess they put this together for a lower cheaper price. Good DVD...but, your better off just saving your money and buying the whole DVD collection of Ghost Stories. Ok if your just a collector...but, not great.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Good, corny fun of a magnitude similar to that of Edward Mulhare's timeless classic, "Secrets and Mysteries", only this time, the distinguished English host is Patrick Macnee, who does a great job hosting these somewhat silly, low-budget ghost stories.The "special" effects and goofy synth music and noises just aid in the good serving of cheesy fun that these episodes provide.A few times, the investigations are so simplistic and dry, you can't help but watch the video, furrow your eyebrows and go, "what?"But who cares!  Are you really watching these for informative information, or are you just looking for a quantum of cheesiness?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I found the picture quality was not very good. Also, wasn't what I expected. I thought I was going to get ghost stories but instead I got people looking for ghosts. It's not what I wanted.

reviewText: This is a very low budget movie. looks like it was filmed in the late 80s to early 90s. Its really not a movie, just somebody interviewing people that suppose to have ghosts in their homes. Gave this dvd to a friend.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The ghost stories themselves are pretty interesting IMHO, however, the fact that the majority of them are filmed during the daytime doesn't lead to a very spooky setting.  They are mostly stories told by people who are being interviewed about them. There is not much reenactment.  I bought the boxed set a few years ago and there were 5 DVDs.  There are stories/interviews from the Tower of London, Tombstone, Arizona, ghosts of Hollywood including the tale of the Black Dahlia, the Black Hope Cemetery story from Texas, also a story about a group of school children who were killed on a bus crossing a railroad track in Texas and whose spirits supposedly will push your vehicle across that same track to safety, Moody's Light in Indiana.  These are just a few that I recall off the top of my head.  Each DVD is approximately an hour long.  They're okay to watch on a rainy day/night if you like ghost stories and have nothing better to do.  I have, however, seen better ghost story reenactments and better settings for ghost stories.  An elderly British actor named Patrick Macnee introduces/narrates the stories.

Title: N/A

reviewText: Ok...I'm kinda dorky and like unusual stuff.  This is one of those rare cases where I really enjoyed what I purchased.  It's not the best by any means...but it was entertaining and there are many stories that were interesting.  Not overly scary but that is good if you have kids.  I liked this better then the "Ghosts and the paranormal" set I purchased recently because it has a lot of ghost stories.  There are even a few people that make me laugh.  Some of the interviews are just funny.  In particular the woman named Elizabeth on the first disc.  She REALLY made me laugh!!!  So if your looking for cheesy, fun and sometimes over-the-top entertainment...this is for you!!!
summary: I liked it!  It's better then some!
